result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jessica L Kowalski was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jessica L Kowalski was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: This sentence is to be served consecutive to any other sentence in being.

superMiscConds.notes:
--To pay fine of $600 + costs= $1,769

--to maintain absolute sobriety
--be subject to SCRAM or similar alcohol monitoring program the at discretion of the agent 
--No operation of motor vehicle without valid driver's license
--not to possess or consume alcohol 
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--to attend a Victim Impact Panel

Arresting Agency: WWPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

Case called at 1:48pm [mo]
Defendant Jessica L Kowalski in court, in custody with Attorney Thomas Brady Aquino.   ADA Jeffrey Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Aquino submits letter from Ms. Kowalski's daughter. 

ADA Shock indicates that he does not have any disputes with the Pre-Sentence Investigation 

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Shock 
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Aquino
The Court questions Atty. Aquino about the lack of mention of substance abuse treatment in PSI
Statement made by Ms. Kowalski to the Court.

On Count #1 the Court sentences Ms. Kowalski   to  5  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 3  years; this sentence is to be served consecutive to any other sentence in being.   

The Court finds that the Defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--To pay fine of $600 + costs= $1769(incl. DNA surcharge)
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--be subject to SCRAM or similar alcohol monitoring program the at discretion of the agent 
--No operation of motor vehicle without valid driver's license
--not to possess or consume alcohol 
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with treatment recommendations
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling or therapy as required by the Agent
--to attend a Victim Impact Panel

The Court orders outright (not as conditions of Extended Supervision):
--Revocation of driving privileges for 36 months
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period 
--Victim impact panel attendance
--6 demerit points assessed


On Count #2 The Court sentences Ms. Kowalski to 9 months in jail; concurrent.
--to pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge; this is to be entered as Civil Judgement

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights given; plea of "Guilty" entered on Counts #1 & #2; factual basis stipulated; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count #3

Case called at 8:30 am
Defendant Jessica L Kowalski in custody, via video from Walworth County Jail with Attorney Thomas B Aquino. ADA John E Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Aquino informs the Court that he received a copy of the criminal complaint, he was just appointed as counsel on Friday.
Court verifies with the defendant that the DOB and address listed on the criminal complaint are correct.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court has reviewed the criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $2,000.00 CASH bond, with conditions: 
-Maintain Absolute Sobriety
-No possession or consumption of any intoxicants
-No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores 
-Not to drive a motor vehicle
-Defendant to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  Defendant to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  Defendant to report for SCRAM installation in Room 230 of the Jefferson County Courthouse on the first Monday or Thursday immediately following release from custody at 1:30 pm.

Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties. (State does request that the Preliminary Hearing be set relatively soon)
Court will have Count #2 track with Count #1.
Court charges Attorney Aquino with having the defendant booked on this case, if Walworth County is unable to book the defendant on this case, then the defendant will be booked when brought to Jefferson County.

Recess: 8:42 am
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 4/30/14 at 9:40 am
Status: 5/9/14 at 2:30 pm 
(Note for JA: State requested that the Preliminary Hearing be set relatively soon, but not within the time limits)
Proposed Order to Produce the Defendant from Walworth County Jail for the 4/14/14 Initial Appearance (with Note from JA: arrangements were made for an appearance by video. Writ not needed)
